author: Poppy C.

description: Came here last weekend.  Between 2 of us we had the spaetzle, fish special (whole trout), bolognese, and the brussels sprouts.  I typically don't like things with liquid cheese, but the spaetzel was so good! The fish was delicious and my husband loved the bolognese.  The best part was the brussels sprouts - I love Brussels sprouts but my husband had never had them before, and usually turned his nose up at them.  He tried them and gobbled the whole thing up.  Service was great, the decor is nice and prices are reasonable for the portions.  Plus, the manager is so nice!
author: Meaghan P.

description:
Wow, this place came out of nowhere... Easy to get a reservation last minute on a Saturday night, close by to good nightlife and the food, the food is amazing!  We weren't super hungry so we shared 4 of probably a total of 6 apps that they offer and each one was better than the next. 

We had the pork belly (which almost all of the reviews recommend), rightfully so, it was delicious, sweet and salty. Then we had the scallops with green curry which came with 3 huge scallops, yummy black rice and really good green curry, I love curry everything so this was a winner for me. Another great dish was the mushroom salad with poached egg and I think some candied hazelnuts? Whatever they were they were delicious. Also do not miss the Brussels sprouts, I mean it, they are awesome.

After all that we ended with the cheesecake which was a massive individual cake topped with fresh fruit and I think a gingersnap crust. Overall, killer meal, totally unpretentious, almost felt like we were in on a secret since the place wasn't packed. Will definitely be back to try out the mains!
author: Ilana T.

description: Good food (loved the mushroom tortilla), friendly people ( hugs to Tina), great service, and comfortable build-out. Will absolutely come back!
author: Robyn W.

description:
Downsides:
- Pork chop was extraordinarily fatty. Vegetables were over-cooked.
- Almond and garlic soup was not particularly tasty; small portion size, too. 
- Salad dressing was too heavy.

Upsides:
- Brussel sprouts were amazing although the serving size is large, too much for a side dish for one.
- Homemade ice cream was really good: vanilla and chocolate but also homemade mint chocolate (great fresh mint flavor) and "pink peppercorn" (unusual, spicy)
author: Nancy S.

description: Pork belly app was amazing. Cool little neighborhood spot. Friendly, helpful staff, limited but very interesting draft beer selection. Had dinner here before going to a show at the Warfield. I would definitely return.
author: Erica A.

description: I love this place. We've been going ever since they started (mostly for brunch, though they do a great dinner too).  My favorite things are the continental breakfast, brussels sprouts, and the french toast (bread pudding!).  The food is great, the service is impeccable, and the vibe is relaxed.  A great place to hangout on the weekend and drink too much mimosa.
author: Anna J.

description:
We called for a reservation the evening of going out and told they were totally booked but the bar area was available for walk-ins.  Sitting at the bar was enjoyable and gave us the opportunity to visit with other diners around us. We compared notes on all the incredible dishes.  Wow! What a great dinner.   Caramelized brussel sprouts, scallops in Thai curry, roast squash salad with arugula and champagne vinaigrette dressing.  Finally  perfectly cooked steak on black rice with grilled greens.  We shared each perfectly seasoned dish.  It was enough for two
.  Definitely on our list when we visit SF again!
author: Beth W.

description: I live in the neighborhood and come here often. Menu changes with the seasons so there's always something new to try. The chef is creative and puts interesting spins on classic dishes (ramen breaded chicken bits, foie gras meatballs) Great beer and wine selection, excellent service and a really beautiful space.
author: Riane W.

description: Great food! It's a small, intimate place with really great food and wine.  I had the pastrami spare rib.  It sounds odd, but it was sooooo good!
author: Eddie C.

description: Excellent brunch!  I had the posole w/eggs and carnitas.  Very flavorful, large portion.  Would definitely come back!!
author: Christopher E.

description: Drool...  Great food. Coming back again!!!
author: Casie M.

description: While visiting SF, we ate here twice and both times it was delicious! I am a picky eater so I usually have trouble at places like this, but I ate every single thing on my plate. The first time I had the Salmon dish which came with black rice that I just loved! My husband had the Butler's steak, which I tried, and that dish was also great. The second visit I had the Chilean Sea Bass, again came with rice but different and also delicious. My husband had the Pork Belly-again, awesome. I highly recommend Ailment from the food to the very chic atmosphere.
author: Nicole M.

description: My favorite brunch spot in the city. The burger is one of best I've had! Wagu beef grilled to perfection with pickles onions and tasty aioli! Fries with jalepeno ranch bring it all home.
author: Christina M.

description: Convenient location, tastefully renovated, nice atmosphere.  Service was strong.  The food was average, larger quantities. Prices reasonable.  As noted, sprouts were good.  Scallops were hearty serving, too spicy.  My feedback to the restaurant - you need to up the food quality a bit.  It is not terrible, but the ingredient quality is lacking and there is not much magic coming out of the kitchen.  Reduce quantity if necessary, but need more creativity.  Now is the time to make a change or this place might not end up making it in the long term.  The food standards in this town are high.  I want you to be successful!
author: Glenn S.

description: Unique and delicious. Good environment. Nice staff. I got the chicken and it was way better than I expected, some spiciness, hearty, great variety of textures and flavors, well-prepared, and well-presented. Classic rock, silent movie on the wall, new favorite. The flower-less chocolate cake as well as the home made mint chocolate chip ice cream made from real mint reduction were great.
author: Josh N.

description: Wonderful new joint in our hood.  Tasty kale salad, brussels sprouts, and spatzel.  Hubby loved the Bolognese.  Great wine and beer.  It was solid good food, cute atmosphere, all without all the typical SF hype around new places.  Great find!
author: Abby K.

description: Ducked in here on a busy Thursday night.  The staff was welcoming and helpful.  The Brussels sprouts were excellent.  We also enjoyed the artichoke salad and pulled pork sliders.
author: Spencer S.

description: Excellent ambiance and food.  Brussel Sprouts were good and the portion is enough to feed 4 people. Bolognese was excellent and right amount of spicy.  Friendly staff.  Sat at the chef's bar top,  fun to watch but they should smile and interact with the people sitting in front of them. Otherwise they stand around with scowls on their faces and the heavy set blonde was checking her phone frequently. Did not see them wash their hands once. Overall, excellent experience outside of the  impression of the chefs.
author: Mary M.

description: Couldn't be persuaded to try the Brussels sprouts although plenty of plates of them seemed to be going out. Aliment has a good selection of wines by the glass and they work well with the food, dominated by meat, although there are a few fish dishes too. The servings are reasonably generous and the execution is absolutely solid. It's a lively, noisy place and it's particularly good for groups.
author: Michelle D.

description: I hate to give Aliment a bad review as it's been a favorite restaurant of ours since it opened. So much so that my husband wanted to celebrate his birthday there last Saturday night. We were five people and spent more than $500. He accidentally forgot his birthday cards in the booth - including one with a $50 gift certificate to the Fatted Calf. We called to ask if they found the cards and they gave him a quick brush off and didn't even try to act like they cared. It was clearly our fault for forgetting the cards, but their reaction definitely put a damper on the special night. Re. the food, while the appetizers and desserts were good there were some entrees (like the rigatoni bolognese which was waaaay too spicy and the steak, which wasn't cooked to order) that really missed the mark. Sadly, I think the shine is off the apple.
author: debra j.

description: The place is delicious and chic :) I especially love their brussel sprouts (I am usually not a brussel sprouts fan, but theirs is so good that even now when I think of it I can feel my mouth becoming watery.) We shared a few appetizers and entrees, and the portions for both were pretty big. Even the appetizers could've easily passed as entrees. The atmosphere and service were very nice too. Great for sharing and going out with friends or a date.
author: Sam C.

description: My wife and I didn't have the best experience here because of some technical issues, which I am confidently going to attribute to just opening. However, the guys here made it right by inviting us to dinner another night. We will be going back again soon. Great beer selection and the food we did have was solid. It should be a great addition to our neighborhood.
author: Steven W.

description:
It's my go to when I want to stay close to home and have a great meal, or just get a nice glass of wine (or an off the path brew).

It's my safe recommendation for friends/co-workers/clients.

The porkchop is amazing (and won't leave you hungry - I'm guessing it's around 2.5" thick!?).

The Brussel sprouts are what the reviews say they are.

The size of the menu describes the quality - they do a few things very, very well.
author: Matthew K.

description: Back for the second time. Fantastic glass of wine and the BEST pork chop I've ever eaten! Definitely check this place out.
author: Melissa C.

description: Great brunch spot, especially on a nice day when they open all doors and windows. The vibe is just perfect. Very relaxed yet the staff is very attentive. If you are a foodie, you'd love this place. We couldn't pick one item because we wanted everything :) tried their Benedict eggs with fish and it was delicious.
author: Aigerim D.

description: The hostess was beautiful and very funny. The food was delicious and came out fast. Every thing she recommended was fabulous. I highly recommend this quaint restaurant!
author: Dean M.

description: Fun restaurant in San Francisco. The selections are made to share. We came just for the brussel spouts and were not disappointed. We also had a kale side and even though We're not big veggies eaters we were in heaven. Everything we ordered was fresh, and delicious.
author: Rhonda R.

description: The food was very good and I would give it 4 stars. Steak, Arctic char, gnocchi, Brussel sprouts were all very good.  I would give the hostess and waitress no stars. No welcome when we come in. No personality. The place was empty and they could care less if we came. A Restuarant should be welcoming when you arrive and engage the customer. They were "too cool" to serve. Disappointed in the experience,
author: V D.

description: I loved this place! Amazing Brussel Sprouts with carmelized fish sauce. So good and very nice atmosphere. Our server was nice and helpful. Close to everything on Bush St.
author: Misty R.

description: We read reviews of restaurants near where we are staying and chose Aliment. We had a fine dining experience. My wife had the Bolognese and said it was among the best she's eaten, which includes versions in Italy. I ordered Gnocchi which was outstanding - small portion, but probably a good thing given the richness of the dish. We shared a salad and appetizer, both specials for the evening and both delicious. The only reason we gave four stars instead of five is due to their lack of iced tea. I was fine - had a glass of wine, but my wife was surprised iced tea was not an option.
author: Eric F.

description: Great space and vibe. Our server, however, was not great. Four of us ordered drinks, and she only brought three to the table, walked away, and it took another 10 minutes to get her attention to remind her of the fourth. After telling us the specials, she sniffed that "that's all I have to say about the food." It was clearly a bother to her that we were there to dine. Mussels and duck were excellent, but pork riblets were over-cooked and dry as a bone. One of the shared dishes we ordered never arrived. Donut and ice cream were worth the extra calories, though ice cream is a little icy if you prefer it on the creamier side. Server then proceeded to rush us out the door - we got more attention from her after she dropped the check than anytime during the meal. I'd potentially go again and give a 2nd chance, but they need serious improvements in their service and there are too many other great options in the city.
author: Lynn B.

description: Horrible!  Bad food laden with msg, and apathetic service.  Stay away!  My husband was violently ill after eating here!  Bad, bad, bad!!!
author: Shannon B.

description: We've been to Aliment a few times now. The food is unique and vegetarian friendly. The place has a great neighborhood vibe but is still upscale. Consistently great food! We definitely have it on our favorite list.
author: Ann R.

description: This is now our go to place for ACT nights! In fact we may find more opportunities to enjoy this great food!
author: Ronald D.

description:
I'm a huge fan of this place already, having eaten here about 4 times. Its cali comfort foo at best, with great veggie menu dishes to keep everyone at the table happy. The deserts are to die for. The chicken is mouthwatering, but my fav dish has to be the brussel sprouts.

Ambiance is down to earth with nice lighting and no drama staff. 

Congrats on some great wines to pair too!

Glad you guys have found your way to the neighborhood....
author: Jill M.

description: my new favorite sunday brunch. coffee and nap inducing bread pudding french toast. and their french fries! i mean... it makes for the start of a perfect sunday. and also dinner is spectacular. we need more places like this in the neighborhood.
author: coffeecake j.

description: Aliment was excellent as always. We introduced a few friends and everyone was very happy w the entrees, desserts and ambience. With drinks included, the bill was ever-reasonable!
author: yumm y.

description: While visiting san francisco, i found this delightful place. I sat at the bar over looking the chef make our food. Great seat and delicious food. My friend and i shared the brussel sprouts amd chilean seabass. All was yummy and i will be back!
author: Marcie K.

description: I feel like this place deserves more than 2 stars given its excellent service and great atmosphere, and I certainly don't want to discourage people from visiting, as Aliment only opened recently.  However, on the sheer basis of the food I tried, it was not very impressive.  Came here for brunch and tried the short rib hash and a soupy pork dish.  While the hash was okay, the pork dish was spicy and lacked flavor otherwise.  Maybe it's just not my cup of tea.
author: Josh Q.

description: love this place for dinner!  everything is yuummy!!  i particularly like the brussel sprouts, steak, and bolognese!  the brussel sprouts are good mix of sweet and salty...it's seriously brussel sprout crack!!  the service is always so awesome when i go there.  it's a yummy yummy place and i hope it survives!  sf has become such a fickle and douchey city that people don't know how to appreciate low key restaurants with good food and service!!
author: Mao K.

description: This is the kind of place we need in the neighborhood. Dan is awesome and I love the unique selection of wine they put together on the list. You really get to try some interesting things. Check out the dry sherry selection. My wife and I drop in for small plates and wine, and have done dinner at the bar, which is a great way to go here. The scallops and kale salad are some of our faves. Oh, and the spaetzle and cheese. Yep. Perfect comfort food done right. Keep it coming, Aliment!
author: Ryan D.

description: I must say, I have never been to a restaurant in San Francisco that has not be accommodating to special requests... until now.  Dining with my friends last night (two meat eaters and two vegetarians) we were impressed by the menu and didn't think twice about ordering the kale salad substituting the anchovy dressing for balsalmic vinegar and oil.  But wait... the server said no substitutions!  What?  Seriously?  "The chef rules with an iron fist and does not make substitutions"  said the server.  Its not like we were asking him to reinvent the wheel here, but alas, no dice.  We dared ask the server if the Brussels sprouts could be made without Bacon - GASP!  No, no dice either.  So, my vegetarian friend and I choked through the spaetzel and cappelini dishes and were overwhelming disappointed that the chef could be so arrogant as not to make a slight change for our dining pleasure.  Gotta hand it to you Aliment, you have proven to know absolutely nothing about the food rules of the SF demographic.
author: Kate E.

description: Big fan!  HUGE.  I absolutely love the bartender and we have been there at least 4-5 times since our first excursion to Aliment.   The bacon jam on the burger -- Delicous.   Wine selection - Divine.   The charcuterie --one of the best that I've had in the city.  Service - wonderful ..... really, this place is definitely on our repeat list.  We have never had a disappointing time here (well once we did ... but that was due to some intoxicated girl patrons at the bar ... which obviously is not the fault of the restaurant itself).  Go -- sit at the bar .... talk to the bartender..... you will have a lovely time.
author: NewtoCali M.

description: I have never had a more offensive experience at a restaurant.  My wife cannot eat dairy because it makes here VERY I'll, but the server ignored our request to remove a dairy component.  When we politely asked someone to tell our server that dairy was still in the dish, they ignored us.  Then the server removed the plate without speaking to us and returned it with the dairy scraped off!
author: Scott S.

description: Very good!  Not cheap but not outrageous. Nice clean look. Good service. Yummy brunch selections without the ridiculous wait time of some nearby places.
author: K L.

description: The Bolognese was very very good.  Pretty cool place, close to Union Square but feels local (like Hopwater).
author: Bryan L.

description: The fried chicken was surprisingly boring but the brunch here is pretty impressive. With Sweet Woodruff down the block I don't see the point in coming here
author: Noza C.

description: Nice almost local hangout feeling restaurant versus a tourist spot.   Food was excellent for the most part.  Sea bass, pork chops (huge serving and very moist and tasty), butcher's steak were all really well prepared.  Short ribs a bit plain and a bit dry but still pretty good.   Pork belly appetizer was delicious.  Limited menu choices but what they had was done well.  Service was good and handled questions on allergies very well. Neat idea having silent movie playing on the wall.  Tonight it was the Hobbit prequel I.
author: B W.

description: Finally, a great place in the neighborhood I want to keep coming back to. My husband  and I have been here several times; each time we have great service and delicious wine and food. The staff are friendly, laid back but attentive. Recent favorite dishes are the hangar steak and mushroom capellini - we practically licked our plates clean. The kale salad and grilled little gems are tasty apps and the brussel sprouts are simply amazing. We're going again tonight!
author: Linda H.

description: Excellent!  Great wine rec's, DELICIOUS meal. Started with fried Brussels sprouts and grilled flatbread, then did a family style dinner with hanger steak, smoked cavatelli, herb spaetzle and merguez.  Chef and servers were fantastic.  Definitely a repeat in our future!!
author: Patricia R.

description: We went here for brunch and the food was fantastic. We got the smoked fish Benedict and the biscuits and gravy. The wait staff was also very friendly and prompt with taking orders, getting refills etc.
author: Cat J.

description: Amazing food was in San Fran for the weekend ended up coming here two days in a row mind blowing food and staff. Dan is the man he is the manager. Must try Brussels sprouts
author: Matthew S.

description: Have an amazing happy hour! Also the Brussel sprouts are like anything you have ever had! I am a huge Brussel sprout eater and nothing I have had since compares!!
author: Eleni J.

description: Delicious! Went to brunch and sat at the bar. Had the bread pudding French toast and short rib hash. Hash was divine, with eggs cooked to perfection. The only thing was that the potatoes were a bit hard for my liking. Hip and happy setting. It is a  perfect twist on comfort food.
author: Ann J.

description: Very friendly pleasant server, food was average. Brussels sprouts starter was pretty good, rest wasn't too great.
author: Ed K.

description: Okay, so I live 2 minutes walking distance from this place and this is the first time I have enjoyed their atmosphere and incredible cuisine! Really, it was quite nice. Sat at the bar, service was great, and the wine, and the kale salad, and cavatelli was excellent. Prepared perfectly, light on the dressing for the salad (which is always good in our minds to not take away from the veggies) and al dente pasta with incredible ingredients and flavors. Well done Aliment! Glad to have you in the neighborhood! See you soon!
author: Bren E.

description: I walked by this place with my wife and was struck by how nice and clean this place was.  We decided to sit down and couldn't have made a better choice.  Every item we ordered was fantastic and our waiter, Daniel, was superb.  Not only was he very attentive, but we asked for suggestions on things to do in SFO and he provided a nice long list of great restaurants and things to check out!
author: Joseph L.

description: We'd been watching the construction for months and were really excited to hear that a new, non-touristy, restaurant was opening in our tourist-heavy neighborhood.  It's exactly what we needed and it does not disappoint.  Our preference is to eat at the bar and this one is perfect for an any-night dinner out. The atmosphere is laid back and relaxing, the service is friendly and on-point, and the food is delicious!  The fried brussel sprouts are something to write home about.  The scallops...the best we've had in quite some time.  We've tried a few of the meat entrees and they've been hearty and super flavorful. Oh --- and the wine list is something to talk about.  They've got a great lineup by the glass that are reasonably priced.  Finally....we have a neighborhood spot!
author: Emily D.

description: We went to dinner here last night, a short block and a half walk from the marine memorial club. Walked in on a Saturday night without reservations.  We got a table for two upstairs. That was nice but the place was packed downstairs and the noise coming up was quite loud. The service was good.  My husband and I both had the kale salad which was delicious.  I'm not a big kale salad person but the kale was sliced so thin and delicious - I would order it again. I had the 'farrotto'root veggies with porcini cream. It was so good and so filling I couldn't finish it. It also had a little arugula salad topping which was a nice adjunct. My husband had the pork chops and couldn't say enough good about them and the eggplant side dish,  there something in the eggplant that looks like potatoes but it's really a rice dumpling like thing -he loved it so had to ask what it was. He didn't say anything about his food being too salty (after reading the other reviews) and he doesn't like overly salty foods -  so I don't think that's an issue. We would definitely return !
author: Karen C.

description: Last Sunday my plans were to go to a movie and have theater nachos for dinner but a friend convinced me to to to Aliment.   I am so glad she did because the experience was phenomenal from the moment we walked in the door.  It started with a warm smiling face greeting us the moment we stepped in and they were busy so I was expecting to wait to be noticed!!   We decided to eat at the counter so we could watch the chefs work, I love doing that for multiple reasons but primarily for two reasons I am a graduate of culinary school so I like to critique them but I also like to watch to learn new techniques from people.  Again, I am so glad we did, the chef was a blonde woman, her name was Chelsea, yes she spoke with us, briefly, and she was awesome!!!  the way she moved around that kitchen it was like it was an extension of her own body, it was shear art watching her do her thing.  Then end result was one of the best meals I have had in a long time.  I had the bolognese which was seasoned and cooked to perfection and my friend had the short ribs... I tried the short ribs and they were flavorful and fall of the bone tender.  If I wasn't so stuffed from the pasta I would have ordered them as well!!    My favorite dish would have to be the Brussel sprouts with caramelized fish sauce!!  yep... you heard me.. Caramelized fish sauce.. never heard of such a thing??? me either.. but it is truly amazing and brought those little cabbages up from oh hum to KA BAM!!!  Seriously YOU HAVE TO HAVE THESE!!  The atmosphere was cozy and classy not to noisy and everyone looked happy and enjoying their meal.  In fact everyone looked so happy that if you took a step back and looked from the outside it would appear that you were peering into the kitchen of someones home while they were having a big family dinner. All in all you can go here for a special occasion or a week day treat or just because you want good food and a very good price and it will be well worth your time!!!  Just GO GO GGOOO!!!
author: M. Allan P.
